title: HTML Attributes
subject: HTML
learning_objectives: Learn common attributes like href, src, width, height, alt, style, lang, title
theory:
# What are Attributes? Attributes provide **additional information** about HTML elements. * All HTML elements can have attributes. * Attributes are always specified in the **start tag**. * Attributes usually come in name/value pairs like: `name="value"`. ## Common Attributes ### 1. `href` Attribute Used in `` tags to specify the URL of the page the link goes to. ```html Visit Google ``` ### 2. `src` Attribute Used in `` tags to specify the path to the image to be displayed. ```html ``` ### 3. `width` and `height` Attributes Specify the size of images (in pixels). ```html ``` ### 4. `alt` Attribute Specifies an alternative text for an image if the image cannot be displayed (crucial for accessibility). ```html ``` ### 5. `style` Attribute Used to add styles to an element, such as color, font, size, etc. ```html

This is red text.

``` ### 6. `lang` Attribute Used in the `` tag to declare the language of the webpage. ```html ``` ### 7. `title` Attribute Defines some extra information about an element. usually shown as a **tooltip** when the mouse moves over the element. ```html

Hover over me!

``` ## Quoting Attribute Values Typically, we use **double quotes**. Single quotes can also be used, but double quotes are the standard convention.

examples.output: Link (clickable), Logo image (100px wide), Text with tooltip.
examples.explanation: Attributes modify the behavior or presentation of the element.

common_mistakes.correction: Attribute names do not have spaces.

interview_questions.question: Where do you define attributes?
interview_questions.answer: Attributes are always defined in the opening (start) tag of an element.

interview_questions.question: What is the importance of the alt attribute?
interview_questions.answer: The alt attribute provides alternative text for screen readers (accessibility) and displays text if the image fails to load. It is crucial for SEO and users with visual impairments.

interview_questions.question: Can I use single quotes for attributes?
interview_questions.answer: Yes, single quotes are valid, but double quotes are the standard convention. Single quotes are useful if the attribute value itself contains a double quote.

practice_problems.problem: Create a link to 'https://openai.com' with the text 'Visit OpenAI' and a tooltip that says 'Go to AI site'.
practice_problems.hint: Use <a> tag with href and title attributes.
practice_problems.solution: Visit OpenAI

real_world_use_cases.description: Screen readers rely heavily on attributes like 'alt' and 'lang' to interpret content for blind users.

exam_notes: Quotes are mandatory for good practice
Key attributes: href (links), src (images), alt (image text), style (css), title (tooltip)
summary: Attributes provide additional power and configuration to HTML elements. They allow you to define image sources, link destinations, stylistic choices, and accessible descriptions. Mastering attributes is key to making HTML elements functional.
